page.title: 15CLAYHANGER:REACTION TO PLANS
page.content: Clayhanger people's reactions to the proposed plans for the area were assessed following the completion of a questionnaire sent to village residents. Replies indicated opposition to the various schemes,the majority being in favour of Clayhanger remaining as it is now. Respondents emphasised the need to retain the village's separate identity and prevent it becoming part of Brownhills and Pelsall.Furthermore, they wished to preserve its peaceful nature which makes it attractive to wild life. Residents objected most strongly to the housing and opencast mining,seeing the alternative road as less of a threat to the local community.Despite such opposition,few householders were ready to leave Clayhanger if the plans were implemented.
